content.body: Jeffrey Yasskin: depends, if they're trying to mimic HTML forms with key/value pairs, they should definitely use that
content.formatted_body: Jeffrey Yasskin: depends, if they're trying to mimic HTML forms with key/value pairs, they should definitely use that

content.body: In particular urlencoded is the only standardized format we have for key/value pairs in URLs so it's not even so much about mimicking HTML forms, it's just that if you're going for that semantic you want to use that format.

content.body: Domenic: is there general guidance for HTML / web platform stuff about when to use options bags arguments vs positional?
content.formatted_body: Domenic: is there general guidance for HTML / web platform stuff about when to use options bags arguments vs positional?

content.body: as a user I am generally happier about options bags because they're easier to read, but we haven't really started leaning in to that

as a designer I've mostly only been using them when there's two or more independently-optional arguments (which is how fromPartialBase64 started, but it may not end up there), since positional arguments are awkward to use in that situation (requiring you to pass `void 0` or whatever)
content.formatted_body: as a designer I've mostly only been using them when there's two or more independently-optional arguments (which is how fromPartialBase64 started, but it may not end up there), since positional arguments are awkward to use in that situation (requiring you to pass void 0 or whatever)

content.body: (though there's an argument for using them when you have even a single optional argument, to leave room for adding more later)

> <@bakkot:matrix.org> Domenic: is there general guidance for HTML / web platform stuff about when to use options bags arguments vs positional?

Maybe https://w3ctag.github.io/design-principles/#prefer-dictionaries?
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @bakkot:matrix.org
Domenic: is there general guidance for HTML / web platform stuff about when to use options bags arguments vs positional?
Maybe https://w3ctag.github.io/design-principles/#prefer-dictionaries?
